entry.title: Adpost - Fuite De Données
entry.content:
Adpost - Fuite de données

Date de la fuite : 2025-02-14
Nombre de comptes affectés : 3 339 512

Description

In February 2025, data allegedly obtained from an earlier Adpost breach surfaced. The dataset contained 3.3M records including email addresses, usernames, and display names. Multiple attempts to contact Adpost regarding the incident received no response.

Données exposées

  • Email addresses
  • Names
  • Usernames

Plus d’informations

  • Vérifier si vous êtes concerné
  • adpost.com
source
entry.summary: Adpost - Fuite

entry.title: Allianz Life - Fuite De Données
entry.content:
Allianz Life - Fuite de données

Date de la fuite : 2025-07-16
Nombre de comptes affectés : 1 115 061

Description

In July 2025, Allianz Life was the victim of a cyber attack which resulted in millions of records later being leaked online. Allianz attributed the attack to “a social engineering technique” which targeted data on Salesforce and resulted in the exposure of 1.1M unique email addresses, names, genders, dates of birth, phone numbers and physical addresses.

Données exposées

  • Dates of birth
  • Email addresses
  • Genders
  • Names
  • Phone numbers
  • Physical addresses

Plus d’informations

  • Vérifier si vous êtes concerné
  • allianzlife.com
source

entry.title: ALIEN TXTBASE Stealer Logs - Fuite De Données
entry.content:
ALIEN TXTBASE Stealer Logs - Fuite de données

Date de la fuite : 2025-02-15
Nombre de comptes affectés : 284 132 969

Description

In February 2025, 23 billion rows of stealer logs were obtained from a Telegram channel known as ALIEN TXTBASE. The data contained 284M unique email addresses alongside the websites they were entered into and the passwords used. This data is now searchable in HIBP by both email domain and the domain of the target website.

Données exposées

  • Email addresses
  • Passwords

Plus d’informations

  • Vérifier si vous êtes concerné
source

entry.title: Adopt Me Trading Values - Fuite De Données
entry.content:
Adopt Me Trading Values - Fuite de données

Date de la fuite : 2022-07-01
Nombre de comptes affectés : 86 136

Description

In July 2022, the Adopt Me Trading Values website for assessing the value of pet trades within the “Adopt Me!” Roblox game suffered a data breach that was later redistributed as part of a larger corpus of data. The breach exposed 86k unique email addresses along with usernames (and Roblox usernames), IP addresses and bcrypt password hashes.

Données exposées

  • Email addresses
  • IP addresses
  • Passwords
  • Usernames

Plus d’informations

  • Vérifier si vous êtes concerné
  • adoptmetradingvalues.com

entry.title: 1win - Fuite De Données
entry.content:
1win - Fuite de données

Date de la fuite : 2024-11-02
Nombre de comptes affectés : 96 166 543

Description

In November 2024, the online betting platform 1win suffered a data breach that exposed 96M users. The exposed data included email and IP addresses, phone numbers, dates of birth, country and SHA-256 password hashes.

Données exposées

  • Dates of birth
  • Email addresses
  • Geographic locations
  • IP addresses
  • Passwords
  • Phone numbers

entry.title: 9Lives - Fuite De Données
entry.content:
9Lives - Fuite de données

Date de la fuite : 2014-10-01
Nombre de comptes affectés : 109 515

Description

In October 2014, the now defunct Belgian gaming news forum 9Lives suffered a data breach that was later redistributed as part of a larger corpus of data. The breach exposed 109k unique email addresses along with usernames and salted MD5 password hashes.

Données exposées

  • Email addresses
  • Passwords
  • Usernames

entry.title: Advance Auto Parts - Fuite De Données
entry.content:
Advance Auto Parts - Fuite de données

Date de la fuite : 2024-06-05
Nombre de comptes affectés : 79 243 727

Description

In June 2024, Advance Auto Parts confirmed they had suffered a data breach which was posted for sale to a popular hacking forum. Linked to unauthorised access to Snowflake cloud services, the breach exposed a large number of records related to both customers and employees. In total, 79M unique email addresses were included in the breach, alongside names, phone numbers, addresses and further data attributes related to company employees.

Données exposées

  • Email addresses
  • Names
  • Phone numbers
  • Physical addresses

Plus d’informations

  • Vérifier si vous êtes concerné
  • advanceautoparts.com
source

entry.title: Acuity - Fuite De Données
entry.content:
Acuity - Fuite de données

Date de la fuite : 2020-06-18
Nombre de comptes affectés : 14 055 729

Description

In mid-2020, a 437GB corpus of data attributed to an entity named “Acuity” was created and later extensively distributed. However, the source could not be confidently verified as any known companies named Acuity. The data totalled over 14M unique email addresses with each row containing extensive personal information across more than 400 columns of data including names, phone numbers, physical addresses, genders and dates of birth.

Données exposées

  • Dates of birth
  • Email addresses
  • Genders
  • IP addresses
  • Names
  • Phone numbers
  • Physical addresses
  • Salutations

Plus d’informations

  • Vérifier si vous êtes concerné
source
entry.summary: Acuity - Fuite

entry.title: Activision - Fuite De Données
entry.content:
Activision - Fuite de données

Date de la fuite : 2022-12-04
Nombre de comptes affectés : 16 006

Description

In December 2022, attackers socially engineered an Activision HR employee into disclosing information which led to the breach of almost 20k employee records. The data contained 16k unique email addresses along with names, phone numbers, job titles and the office location of the employee. Activision advised that no sensitive employee information was included in the breach.

Données exposées

  • Email addresses
  • Geographic locations
  • Job titles
  • Names
  • Phone numbers

Plus d’informations

  • Vérifier si vous êtes concerné
  • activision.com
source
entry.summary: Act

entry.title: Adecco - Fuite De Données
entry.content:
Adecco - Fuite de données

Date de la fuite : 2021-01-03
Nombre de comptes affectés : 4 284 538

Description

In March 2021, news broke of a massive data breach impacting millions of Adecco customers in South America which was subsequently sold on a popular hacking forum. The breach exposed over 4M unique email addresses as well as genders, dates of birth, marital statuses, phone numbers and passwords stored as bcrypt hashes.

Données exposées

  • Email addresses
  • Genders
  • Geographic locations
  • Marital statuses
  • Names
  • Passwords
  • Phone numbers

Plus d’informations

  • Vérifier si vous êtes concerné
  • adecco.com
source
entry.summary: Adecco - Fuite

entry.title: Aimware - Fuite De Données
entry.content:
Aimware - Fuite de données

Date de la fuite : 2019-04-28
Nombre de comptes affectés : 305 470

Description

In mid-2019, the video game cheats website “Aimware” suffered a data breach that exposed hundreds of thousands of subscribers’ personal information. Data included email and IP addresses, usernames, forum posts, private messages, website activity and passwords stored as salted MD5 hashes.

Données exposées

  • Email addresses
  • IP addresses
  • Passwords
  • Private messages
  • Usernames
  • Website activity

Plus d’informations

  • Vérifier si vous êtes concerné
  • aimware.net
source
entry.summary: Aimware - Fu

entry.title: Aditya Birla Fashion and Retail - Fuite De Données
entry.content:
Aditya Birla Fashion and Retail - Fuite de données

Date de la fuite : 2021-12-01
Nombre de comptes affectés : 5 470 063

Description

In December 2021, Indian retailer Aditya Birla Fashion and Retail Ltd was breached and ransomed. The ransom demand was allegedly rejected and data containing 5.4M unique email addresses was subsequently dumped publicly on a popular hacking forum the next month. The data contained extensive personal customer information including names, phone numbers, physical addresses, DoBs, order histories and passwords stored as MD5 hashes. Employee data was also dumped publicly and included salary grades, marital statuses and religions.

Données exposées

  • Email addresses
  • Genders
  • Income levels
  • Job titles
  • Marital statuses
  • Names
  • Passwords
  • Phone numbers
  • Physical addresses
  • Purchases
  • Religions
  • Salutations

Plus d’informations

  • Vérifier si vous êtes concerné
  • abfrl.com
source
entry.summary: <h1 id="Aditya-Birla-Fashion-and-Retail-Fuite-de-donnees"><a href="#Aditya-Birla-Fashion-and-Retail-Fuite-de-donnees" class="headerlink" tit

entry.title: ActMobile - Fuite De Données
entry.content:
ActMobile - Fuite de données

Date de la fuite : 2021-10-08
Nombre de comptes affectés : 1 583 193

Description

In October 2021, security researcher Bob Diachenko discovered an exposed database he attributed to ActMobile, the operators of Dash VPN and FreeVPN. The exposed data included 1.6 million unique email addresses along with IP addresses and password hashes, all of which were subsequently leaked on a popular hacking forum. Although usage of the service was verified by HIBP subscribers, ActMobile denied the data was sourced from them and the breach has subsequently been flagged as “unverified”.

Données exposées

  • Email addresses
  • IP addresses

Plus d’informations

  • Vérifier si vous êtes concerné
  • actmobile.com
source
entry.summary: ActMob

entry.title: Ajarn - Fuite De Données
entry.content:
Ajarn - Fuite de données

Date de la fuite : 2018-12-13
Nombre de comptes affectés : 266 399

Description

In September 2021, the Thai-based English language teaching website Ajarn discovered they’d been the victim of a data breach dating back to December 2018. The breach was self-submitted to HIBP and included 266k email addresses, names, genders, phone numbers and other personal information. Hashed passwords were also impacted in the breach.

Données exposées

  • Dates of birth
  • Education levels
  • Email addresses
  • Genders
  • Geographic locations
  • Job applications
  • Marital statuses
  • Names
  • Nationalities
  • Passwords
  • Phone numbers
  • Profile photos

Plus d’informations

  • Vérifier si vous êtes concerné
  • ajarn.com
source
entry.summary: Ajarn - Fuite de d

entry.title: 123RF - Fuite De Données
entry.content:
123RF - Fuite de données

Date de la fuite : 2020-03-22
Nombre de comptes affectés : 8 661 578

Description

In March 2020, the stock photo site 123RF suffered a data breach which impacted over 8 million subscribers and was subsequently sold online. The breach included email, IP and physical addresses, names, phone numbers and passwords stored as MD5 hashes. The data was provided to HIBP by dehashed.com.

Données exposées

  • Email addresses
  • IP addresses
  • Names
  • Passwords
  • Phone numbers
  • Physical addresses
  • Usernames

Plus d’informations

  • Vérifier si vous êtes concerné
  • 123rf.com
source
entry.summary: 123RF - Fuite de d

entry.title: AgusiQ-Torrents.pl - Fuite De Données
entry.content:
AgusiQ-Torrents.pl - Fuite de données

Date de la fuite : 2019-09-24
Nombre de comptes affectés : 90 478

Description

In September 2019, Polish torrent site AgusiQ-Torrents.pl suffered a data breach. The incident exposed 90k member records including email and IP addresses, usernames and passwords stored as MD5 hashes.

Données exposées

  • Email addresses
  • IP addresses
  • Passwords
  • Usernames

  • Vérifier si vous êtes concerné

entry.title: 500px - Fuite De Données
entry.content:
500px - Fuite de données

Date de la fuite : 2018-07-05
Nombre de comptes affectés : 14 867 999

Description

In mid-2018, the online photography community 500px suffered a data breach. The incident exposed almost 15 million unique email addresses alongside names, usernames, genders, dates of birth and either an MD5 or bcrypt password hash. In 2019, the data appeared listed for sale on a dark web marketplace (along with several other large breaches) and subsequently began circulating more broadly.

Données exposées

  • Dates of birth
  • Email addresses
  • Genders
  • Geographic locations
  • Names
  • Passwords
  • Usernames

Plus d’informations

  • Vérifier si vous êtes concerné
  • 500px.com
source

entry.title: 8fit - Fuite De Données
entry.content:
8fit - Fuite de données

Date de la fuite : 2018-07-01
Nombre de comptes affectés : 15 025 407

Description

In July 2018, the health and fitness service 8fit suffered a data breach. The data subsequently appeared for sale on a dark web marketplace in February 2019 and included over 15M unique email addresses alongside names, genders, IP addresses and passwords stored as bcrypt hashes. The data was provided to HIBP by dehashed.com.

Données exposées

  • Email addresses
  • Genders
  • Geographic locations
  • IP addresses
  • Names
  • Passwords

Plus d’informations

  • Vérifier si vous êtes concerné
  • 8fit.com

entry.title: AerServ - Fuite De Données
entry.content:
AerServ - Fuite de données

Date de la fuite : 2018-04-01
Nombre de comptes affectés : 66 308

Description

In April 2018, the ad management platform known as AerServ suffered a data breach. Acquired by InMobi earlier in the year, the AerServ breach impacted over 66k unique email addresses and also included contact information and passwords stored as salted SHA-512 hashes. The data was publicly posted to Twitter later in 2018 after which InMobi was notified and advised they were aware of the incident.

Données exposées

  • Email addresses
  • Employers
  • Job titles
  • Names
  • Passwords
  • Phone numbers
  • Physical addresses

Plus d’informations

  • Vérifier si vous êtes concerné
  • aerserv.com
source
entry.summary: AerServ - Fu

entry.title: Adapt - Fuite De Données
entry.content:
Adapt - Fuite de données

Date de la fuite : 2018-11-05
Nombre de comptes affectés : 9 363 740

Description

In November 2018, security researcher Bob Diachenko identified an unprotected database hosted by data aggregator “Adapt”. A provider of “Fresh Quality Contacts”, the service exposed over 9.3M unique records of individuals and employer information including their names, employers, job titles, contact information and data relating to the employer including organisation description, size and revenue. No response was received from Adapt when contacted.

Données exposées

  • Email addresses
  • Employers
  • Job titles
  • Names
  • Phone numbers
  • Physical addresses
  • Social media profiles

Plus d’informations

  • Vérifier si vous êtes concerné
  • adapt.io
source

entry.title: Adult-FanFiction.Org - Fuite De Données
entry.content:
Adult-FanFiction.Org - Fuite de données

Date de la fuite : 2018-05-30
Nombre de comptes affectés : 186 082

Description

In May 2018, the website for sharing adult-orientated works of fiction known as Adult-FanFiction.Org had 186k records exposed in a data breach. The data contained names, email addresses, dates of birth and passwords stored as both MD5 hashes and plain text. AFF did not respond when contacted about the breach and the site was previously reported as compromised on the Vigilante.pw breached database directory.

Données exposées

  • Dates of birth
  • Email addresses
  • Names
  • Passwords

Plus d’informations

  • Vérifier si vous êtes concerné
  • adult-fanfiction.org
source

entry.title: 17173 - Fuite De Données
entry.content:
17173 - Fuite de données

Date de la fuite : 2011-12-28
Nombre de comptes affectés : 7 485 802

Description

In late 2011, a series of data breaches in China affected up to 100 million users, including 7.5 million from the gaming site known as 17173. Whilst there is evidence that the data is legitimate, due to the difficulty of emphatically verifying the Chinese breach it has been flagged as “unverified”. The data in the breach contains usernames, email addresses and salted MD5 password hashes and was provided with support from dehashed.com. Read more about Chinese data breaches in Have I Been Pwned.

Données exposées

  • Email addresses
  • Passwords
  • Usernames

Plus d’informations

  • Vérifier si vous êtes concerné
  • 17173.com
source
entry.summary: 17173 - Fuite de d

entry.title: 2,844 Separate Data Breaches - Fuite De Données
entry.content:
2,844 Separate Data Breaches - Fuite de données

Date de la fuite : 2018-02-19
Nombre de comptes affectés : 80 115 532

Description

In February 2018, a massive collection of almost 3,000 alleged data breaches was found online. Whilst some of the data had previously been seen in Have I Been Pwned, 2,844 of the files consisting of more than 80 million unique email addresses had not previously been seen. Each file contained both an email address and plain text password and were consequently loaded as a single “unverified” data breach.

Données exposées

  • Email addresses
  • Passwords

Plus d’informations

  • Vérifier si vous êtes concerné
source

entry.title: 8tracks - Fuite De Données
entry.content:
8tracks - Fuite de données

Date de la fuite : 2017-06-27
Nombre de comptes affectés : 17 979 961

Description

In June 2017, the online playlists service known as 8Tracks suffered a data breach which impacted 18 million accounts. In their disclosure, 8Tracks advised that “the vector for the attack was an employee’s GitHub account, which was not secured using two-factor authentication”. Salted SHA-1 password hashes for users who didn’t sign up with either Google or Facebook authentication were also included. The data was provided to HIBP by whitehat security researcher and data analyst Adam Davies and contained almost 8 million unique email addresses. The complete set of 18M records was later provided by JimScott.Sec@protonmail.com and updated in HIBP accordingly.

Données exposées

  • Email addresses
  • Passwords

Plus d’informations

  • Vérifier si vous êtes concerné
  • 8tracks.com
source
entry.summary: 8tracks - Fu

entry.content:
2fast4u - Fuite de données

Date de la fuite : 2017-12-20
Nombre de comptes affectés : 17 706

Description

In December 2017, the Belgian motorcycle forum 2fast4u discovered a data breach of their system. The breach of the vBulletin message board impacted over 17k individual users and exposed email addresses, usersnames and salted MD5 passwords.

Données exposées

  • Email addresses
  • Passwords

entry.title: ai.type - Fuite De Données
entry.content:
ai.type - Fuite de données

Date de la fuite : 2017-12-05
Nombre de comptes affectés : 20 580 060

Description

In December 2017, the virtual keyboard application ai.type was found to have left a huge amount of data publicly facing in an unsecured MongoDB instance. Discovered by researchers at The Kromtech Security Center, the 577GB data set included extensive personal information including over 20 million unique email addresses, social media profiles and address book contacts. The email addresses alone were provided to HIBP to enable impacted users to assess their exposure.

Données exposées

  • Address book contacts
  • Apps installed on devices
  • Cellular network names
  • Dates of birth
  • Device information
  • Email addresses
  • Genders
  • Geographic locations
  • IMEI numbers
  • IMSI numbers
  • IP addresses
  • Names
  • Phone numbers
  • Profile photos
  • Social media profiles

Plus d’informations

  • Vérifier si vous êtes concerné
  • aitype.com
source
entry.summary: ai.type - Fu

entry.title: AbuseWith.Us - Fuite De Données
entry.content:
AbuseWith.Us - Fuite de données

Date de la fuite : 2016-07-01
Nombre de comptes affectés : 1 372 550

Description

In 2016, the site dedicated to helping people hack email and online gaming accounts known as Abusewith.us suffered multiple data breaches. The site allegedly had an administrator in common with the nefarious LeakedSource site, both of which have since been shut down. The exposed data included more than 1.3 million unique email addresses, often accompanied by usernames, IP addresses and plain text or hashed passwords retrieved from various sources and intended to be used to compromise the victims’ accounts.

Données exposées

  • Email addresses
  • IP addresses
  • Passwords
  • Usernames

Plus d’informations

  • Vérifier si vous êtes concerné
  • abusewith.us
source

entry.title: AKP Emails - Fuite De Données
entry.content:
AKP Emails - Fuite de données

Date de la fuite : 2016-07-19
Nombre de comptes affectés : 917 461

Description

In July 2016, a hacker known as Phineas Fisher hacked Turkey’s ruling party (Justice and Development Party or “AKP”) and gained access to 300k emails. The full contents of the emails were subsequently published by WikiLeaks and made searchable. HIBP identified over 917k unique email address patterns in the data set, including message IDs and a number of other non-user addresses.

Données exposées

  • Email addresses
  • Email messages

Plus d’informations

  • Vérifier si vous êtes concerné
  • akparti.org.tr
source

entry.title: 7k7k - Fuite De Données
entry.content:
7k7k - Fuite de données

Date de la fuite : 2011-01-01
Nombre de comptes affectés : 9 121 434

Description

In approximately 2011, it’s alleged that the Chinese gaming site known as 7k7k suffered a data breach that impacted 9.1 million subscribers. Whilst there is evidence that the data is legitimate, due to the difficulty of emphatically verifying the Chinese breach it has been flagged as “unverified”. The data in the breach contains usernames, email addresses and plain text passwords. Read more about Chinese data breaches in Have I Been Pwned.

Données exposées

  • Email addresses
  • Passwords
  • Usernames

entry.content:
Aipai.com - Fuite de données

Date de la fuite : 2016-09-27
Nombre de comptes affectés : 6 496 778

Description

In September 2016, data allegedly obtained from the Chinese gaming website known as Aipai.com and containing 6.5M accounts was leaked online. Whilst there is evidence that the data is legitimate, due to the difficulty of emphatically verifying the Chinese breach it has been flagged as “unverified”. The data in the breach contains email addresses and MD5 password hashes. Read more about Chinese data breaches in Have I Been Pwned.

Données exposées

entry.content:
000webhost - Fuite de données

Date de la fuite : 2015-03-01
Nombre de comptes affectés : 14 936 670

Description

In approximately March 2015, the free web hosting provider 000webhost suffered a major data breach that exposed almost 15 million customer records. The data was sold and traded before 000webhost was alerted in October. The breach included names, email addresses and plain text passwords.

entry.title: AhaShare.com - Fuite De Données
entry.content:
AhaShare.com - Fuite de données

Date de la fuite : 2013-05-30
Nombre de comptes affectés : 180 468

Description

In May 2013, the torrent site AhaShare.com suffered a breach which resulted in more than 180k user accounts being published publicly. The breach included a raft of personal information on registered users plus despite assertions of not distributing personally identifiable information, the site also leaked the IP addresses used by the registered identities.

Données exposées

  • Email addresses
  • Genders
  • Geographic locations
  • IP addresses
  • Partial dates of birth
  • Passwords
  • Usernames
  • Website activity

  • Vérifier si vous êtes concerné
  • ahashare.com

entry.title: Adobe - Fuite De Données
entry.content:
Adobe - Fuite de données

Date de la fuite : 2013-10-04
Nombre de comptes affectés : 152 445 165

Description

In October 2013, 153 million Adobe accounts were breached with each containing an internal ID, username, email, encrypted password and a password hint in plain text. The password cryptography was poorly done and many were quickly resolved back to plain text. The unencrypted hints also disclosed much about the passwords adding further to the risk that hundreds of millions of Adobe customers already faced.

Données exposées

  • Email addresses
  • Password hints
  • Passwords
  • Usernames

Plus d’informations

  • Vérifier si vous êtes concerné
  • adobe.com
source
entry.summary: Adobe - Fuite de d
